result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Drew A. Straight

defendant.name: Straight, Drew A.
defendant.address: 508 S. Washington St. #4, Cuba City, WI 53807

records.addlTxt: 2:01 PM Attorney Jennifer M. Harper appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael C. Curran appeared by video for Drew A. Straight. Defendant not present. Court had ordered Def to appear in person in Richland County Courtroom. He has not appeared. Atty. Curran states Def may be in a treatment facility but can't confirm if he's out. DA asks for a warrant - no reason to keep setting things until the warrant is satisfied. Court authorizes the warrant - body only. Hearing concluded at 2:07 p.m.
Status conference on August 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:15 a.m. Defendant Drew A. Straight not in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael C. Curran appeared for the Def. Court notes that, at the last hearing, Court ordered the Defendant be in court, in person, in Richland County for today's hearing. Based on Def's non-appearance today, DA Harper requests warrant in each of the three cases. Atty. Curran argues against the State's request; reports that the Def's significant other reports today that the Def has checked himself into a facility. Court states that Def will have to prove that he's been admitted to the hospital to avoid the warrant; in the meantime, sets a new date. Court sets 8/8 at 2:00 p.m. Counsel may appear by Zoom. Defendant must be in person.
Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on July 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:33 PM Defendant Drew A. Straight appeared by phone.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael C. Curran appeared by video for Drew A. Straight. 17CF94, 21CM154, and 22CF28 on the calendar for status. DA requests Def turn his video on. Def refuses. Court states next appearance will be in person, not Zoom. DA has noted Def has P/P warrant. Atty. Curran addresses the Court. Court questions whether time limits have been waived for prelim. Atty. Curran states they have. DA Harper requests that next hearing in these matters be held in person in the Richland County Courtroom, soon. Court sets 7/8 at 10, all parties in person, Richland County Courtroom.
Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:58 AM 2021CM000154, 2022CF000028, 2017CF000094 -Defendant Drew A. Straight appeared by phone.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael C. Curran appeared by video for Drew A. Straight. Attorney Curran hasn't been able to speak to his client but has received an offer. Attorney Curran ask for a status.
Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on April 25, 2022 at 10:45 am.

9:20 AM 22CF28/21CM154/17CF94- Defendant Drew A. Straight appeared by phone.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael C. Curran appeared by video for Drew A. Straight. Case 22CF28, Attorney Curran has received the criminal complaint and waives the formal reading. Court informs the defendant of the max penalties. Attorney Curran states that there is no resolution and hasn't met with his client to go over the facts of the case. Attorney Curran asks for another status.
Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
